Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First looking at the system log entries I see a series of actions like FOCUS TYPING SWITCH etc The challenge is to group these into cases Let me see the sequence Starting from the first entry at 085950 the user focuses on Quarterly Report docx Then immediately after they focus on Document1 docx Hmm maybe these are two different documents so perhaps separate cases But the next actions are typing in Document1 docx saving switching to Chrome etc

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: So maybe each document like Document1 Quarterly Report etc is a case That makes sense since they are working on different documents So the Case ID could be the document name Let me check if that holds Looking at the entries Document1 docx Events from 090000 to 090700 when its closed Then after that its closed so maybe thats a case for Document1 Quarterly Report docx The first focus at 085950 then again at 090715

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: The SWITCH from Word to Chrome might indicate that the user is handling an email related to the document so part of the Document1 case Or is the email handling a separate case The user clicks on an email replies which might be a separate task Alternatively maybe the main case is the document and the email interaction is part of that case Hmm this is tricky

Name: Backtracking - NE
Text: Wait the Quarterly case is split into two parts Or maybe the initial FOCUS on Quarterly was a separate task but the user didnt do much else there Hmm tricky Alternatively maybe the case is based on the document being active again Since after closing Document1 they work on Quarterly again at 090715 maybe thats a new instance Or maybe the same case continues if its reopened Wait in process mining a case is a process instance So if the user closes and reopens the document maybe thats a new instance

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Alternatively if the document was left open the case continues Since the user closed Document1 thats an end Quarterly wasnt closed until the end so all Quarterly events are in one case Therefore the Case ID will be the document name Now activity naming The raw actions like FOCUS TYPING etc need to be translated into higherlevel activities For example FOCUS might be Open Document or Start Editing TYPING could be Editing Content or Writing Text SAVE is Save Document

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: So the case ID for Document1 would be all events while the user was working on it even if they switched to another app temporarily So for the SWITCH to Chrome that events case would still be Document1 docx as the task is still related to that documents process Similarly the Excel work is part of the Document1 case Alternatively the case could be the users task which might involve multiple documents and applications But thats harder to track

Name: Validation - PE
Text: This approach would make the case more comprehensive Therefore the SWITCH actions like switching to Chrome would be activities in the current case Document1s case The actions in Chrome like replying to email are part of handling that documents process so their activity names could be Reply to Email or Handle Email The Acrobats Report Draft pdf might be part of the Quarterly case but if the user is working on Report Draft pdf thats a separate case

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: This is getting too complex Maybe the best approach is to assign each documents events when focused to its own case and other actions like email Acrobat Excel are separate cases Alternatively the case is the active document So when they focus on a document thats the start of the case and when they close it it ends Therefore when the user is in Chrome they are not in a document so not part of any document case until they return
